meanings.definition: Mix (ingredients) together too much or for too long.
meanings.sent1: She ruined the cake by overmixing the batter until it was too thin.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to overmix the dough or the cookies will turn out tough.
meanings.sent3: The chef overmixed the soup so much that it turned into a strange, bubbly mess.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were overmixed, creating a confusing blend of joy and sadness.
meanings.sent5: The artist overmixed the colors, resulting in a muddy and unappealing painting.

meanings.definition: The act of mixing ingredients together excessively.
meanings.sent1: Overmixing can lead to a cake that doesn't rise properly.
meanings.sent2: The overmixing of the batter caused the cookies to be flat and hard.
meanings.sent3: The overmixing of the salad made it look like a colorful mush.
meanings.sent4: In the world of music, overmixing can result in a distorted and unpleasant sound.
meanings.sent5: The overmixing of the paint colors created a dull and uninteresting artwork.
